title: Mammoth not making excuses after 4-2 loss to Kings
description: A few recurring problems plagued the Mammoth again on Monday. Hereâ€™s what theyâ€™re doing about them.
fullText:
The Utah Mammoth are finally home from their tour of North America, but that doesnâ€™t mean things will be easier for them.

They learned that with their 4-2 loss to the Los Angeles Kings at the Delta Center on Monday. Hereâ€™s the story.

A two-goal deficit is one of the worst ways to start a hockey game, but thatâ€™s challenge the Mammoth faced in this one.

Both of the Kingsâ€™ early goals came off of odd-man rushes â€” a 3-on-2 which turned into a partial break for Adrian Kempe and a full-on breakaway for Joel Armia.

Brandon Tanev answered with a breakaway goal of his own to cut the Kingsâ€™ lead in half, but a successful offside challenge took the tally off the board.

Dylan Guenther opened the second period with a power play one-timer goal, but AnÅ¾e Kopitar restored the Kingsâ€™ two-goal lead at the beginning of the third.

The Mammoth pulled back within one courtesy of a sweet backhander by Clayton Keller, but their 6-on-5 struggles continued as Armia sent one into the empty net.

ğŸš¨Gunner on the power play! pic.twitter.com/dHYagZRGTA

â€” Utah Mammoth (@utahmammoth) December 9, 2025

The culprit in the Mammothâ€™s last two games has been bad first periods.

In Calgary on Saturday, the Flames scored what ended up being the game-winning goal 16 seconds into the game. It wasnâ€™t quite as drastic against the Kings on Monday, but allowing them to take a 2-0 lead into the first intermission created a hole that was hard to get out of.

â€œIn the first period, we definitely gave them too much space,â€ said Utah head coach AndrÃ© Tourginy. â€œWe let them take the middle on the rush, so they had too many (zone) entries. ... By giving them the lead, that made them play their strengths even more.â€

While the Mammoth have historically been good in the first period and awful in the second, the last handful of games have been the opposite.

Up to and including their loss in San Jose on Dec. 1, the Mammoth had a -13 goal differential in second periods. Over the last four games, however, theyâ€™re +4 in the middle frame â€” and they havenâ€™t given up a single second-period goal in that stretch.

It would be easy to blame poor starts on the tough travel: seven games spanning four states and two provinces in the last 11 days, but Tourigny didnâ€™t take that option.

â€œI donâ€™t want to use that as an excuse,â€ he said. â€œItâ€™s there, but so (it is for) the other team. (In the) NHL, thereâ€™s nobody who will feel sorry for you. Itâ€™s not a league where you have to find excuses â€” itâ€™s not like that. You need to find solutions, you need to find a way."

Tourigny has frequently mentioned the parity in the NHL: On most given nights, the bulk of the games will be decided by just one goal (excluding empty-netters).

Since the beginning of November, 10 of the Mammothâ€™s 14 losses have been exactly that way. That should encourage players and fans alike: Theyâ€™re one good play short of better outcomes in most of these situations.

They just need one more guy to step up every night.

Tourigny couldnâ€™t point to a particular pattern that has led to so many one-goal losses, but speaking on this game in particular, he broke down the Kingsâ€™ second goal, when Armia snuck in behind Utahâ€™s defensemen before accepting a stretch pass to send him on a breakaway.

â€œThe second goal should have never happened,â€ Tourigny said. â€œWeâ€™re casual, and thatâ€™s the difference in the game. Thatâ€™s how tight the league is.â€

That should be encouraging for Mammoth fans: This isnâ€™t a matter of skill, itâ€™s a matter of consistency â€” and it is a surmountable problem.

Another shift or two of buy-in from each line is all itâ€™s going to take for Utah to come out on the winning side of the bulk of these games.

Mammoth social media circles have been filled with requests for a coaching change, but Keller shut that idea down in his postgame interview.

â€œWe know what we need to do each night. The coaches do a great job of telling us how we have to play and how we can break them down and have success,â€ he said.

â€œI think our execution was a little sloppy tonight, but as the game went on, I think it got a little bit better.â€

As mentioned after the teamâ€™s loss in San Jose last week, coaching changes typically only happen when the players stop buying into the coachesâ€™ messages. As captain, part of Kellerâ€™s job is to speak for the players â€” and right now, the players are saying that coaching isnâ€™t the problem.

The onus is now on Keller and the other 22 players on the roster to show that this is the group that itâ€™ll take to accomplish their stated goal of making the playoffs this season.

NHL Edge doesnâ€™t publicly keep track of the leagueâ€™s hardest backhanders, but if it did, Kellerâ€™s goal may have been atop the list.

The backhander is the most difficult shot to take with any degree of strength or accuracy, which is why they almost exclusively happen from in tight. But this one was good enough to beat 2025 Vezina Trophy finalist Darcy Kuemper point-blank.

Back-handed beauty from the Captain ğŸ«¡ pic.twitter.com/WgVBFhihmn

â€” Utah Mammoth (@utahmammoth) December 9, 2025

title: Dybalaâ€™s new contract is at risk
description: As the winter transfer window approaches, Paulo Dybalaâ€™s future is once again in the spotlight. According to La Repubblica, a meeting is scheduled for the coming days between Roma management and the...
fullText:
As the winter transfer window approaches, Paulo Dybalaâ€™s future is once again in the spotlight.

According to La Repubblica, a meeting is scheduled for the coming days between Roma management and the Argentine strikerâ€™s agent, Carlos Novel, to discuss the path forward and the terms of a mutually satisfactory agreement.

At the same time, rumors of an early departure have intensified, with Boca Juniors indicated as a preferred destination, ready to welcome him as early as January.

In Buenos Aires, his friend and former teammate Leandro Paredes is benefiting, having repeatedly expressed his desire to share the footballing experience with Dybala again.

At present, there does not appear to be any reason for an imminent departure.

Dybala is happy in Rome, where he has chosen to build his personal life and raise his daughter, who is expected in March.

This emotional bond with the capital, however, does not appear to be sufficient to secure his professional future. The sticking point remains his contract renewal, which is currently on hold.

Any negotiations will have to comply with the guidelines set by the Friedkins, which are geared toward investing in players under 30 and reducing the burden of higher salaries.

Dybala is the exception: â€œLa Joyaâ€ commands approximately â‚¬8.5 million net per season. The Argentineâ€™s contract expires on June 30, 2026, and will not be renewed under the same financial conditions.

For Roma, this is a strategic decision, balancing financial sustainability with the need to retain one of the squadâ€™s key players. The upcoming meeting could mark a crucial step in outlining future scenarios.

title: Bradley Barcola: Man United considering using Marcus Rashford to sign PSG winger
description: Manchester United enjoyedÂ a goalfest at Molineux Stadium, winning 4-1 against Wolverhampton Wanderers.Bruno Fernandes, Mason Mount and Bryan Mbeumo all got on the scoresheet on Monday night, taking f...
fullText:
Manchester United enjoyedÂ a goalfest at Molineux Stadium, winning 4-1 against Wolverhampton Wanderers.

Bruno Fernandes, Mason Mount and Bryan Mbeumo all got on the scoresheet on Monday night, taking full advantage of the 20th-placed sideâ€™s shaky defending.

But it was a frustrating return to the Midlands for Matheus Cunha, who lacked incisiveness around the goalmouth. Cunha scored 15 times in the Premier League for Wolves last season, but he has just one goal to his name at United.

If the Brazilian left winger continues to underwhelm, United might be compelled to bring in another left-sided attacker to strengthen their ranks.

Before Amorim arrived, Marcus Rashford and Alejandro Garnacho competed for the starting spot out on the left at Old Trafford. However, the pair fell out with the Portuguese.

The Red Devils sent Garnacho to Chelsea in a permanent deal. Rashford, meanwhile, was loaned out to Barcelona. The La Liga giants do have an option to buy the Englishman but their transfer strategy remains uncertain.

The England international is thriving at Barca, leading to long-term admirers Paris Saint-Germain reigniting their interest in his services.

According to Fichajes, United are considering using Rashford to secure the signature of a PSG left winger.

The Spanish outlet claim United are interested in Bradley Barcola and are â€œseriouslyâ€ planning to sign him next summer.

The 23-year-old Frenchman is known for his dazzling dribbling, lightning-fast feet, and versatility. His profile fits perfectly with the Premier League giantsâ€™ emphasis on young and dynamic players.

It is understood United are considering a swap deal involving Barcola and Rashford.

The France international has 31 goals and 33 assists to his name in 121 appearances for PSG. However, he has struggled for regular starts following the arrival of Khvicha Kvaratskhelia.

Further, negotiations to renew the â‚¬70m-rated forwardâ€™s contract at PSG have allegedly stalled. Accordingly, United are looking to capitalise on Barcolaâ€™s situation.

title: â€˜Desperately disappointedâ€™ Mark Wood ruled out of Ashes with knee injury as England call up replacement
description: Australia, meanwhile, have ruled Josh Hazlewood out of the final three Tests
fullText:
Mark Wood has been ruled out of the rest of the Ashes series in a major injury blow for England.

Wood featured in the opening Test in Perth but suffered a left knee issue, bowling just 11 overs before being declared unavailable before the defeat in Brisbane.

The 35-year-old, who missed the entire English summer after a nine-month recovery from knee surgery, has now been ruled out of the entirety of the series, leaving captain Ben Stokes without his most experienced seamer and fastest bowler as England look to fight back from 2-0 down.

â€œGutted to be out the remainder of the Ashes,â€ Wood posted on Instagram. â€œAfter extensive surgery and seven long, hard months of work and rehab to get back into the test arena, my knee just hasn't held up.

â€œNone of us expected this. I came here with high expectations about making a big impact. Iâ€™m desperately disappointed that despite yet more injections and intensive medical treatment it has become clear that the flare up in my knee is worse than feared.

â€œIâ€™m really sorry that has left me unable to perform as expected but it is not for want of trying. I still believe we can turn things around. Never give in. Come on England.â€

Surreyâ€™s Matthew Fisher has been called up to the squad ahead of the third Test in Adelaide, which begins on 17 December. Fisher has one international cap, earned on a tour of the West Indies in the absence of James Anderson and Stuart Broad in 2022 while at Yorkshire.

While not as quick as Wood, Fisher produced an impressive first season in the County Championship at Surrey after moving south, although was wicketless for the England Lions in a heavy defeat to Australia A in Brisbane this week.

Australia, meanwhile, have confirmed that Josh Hazlewood will play no part in the series. The 34-year-old fast bowler suffered a hamstring problem ahead of the Ashes and is now experiencing an achilles issue.

It is hoped that Hazlewood may return for the T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka in February.

"(I'm) really flat for him," head coach Andrew McDonald said of Hazlewood.

"A couple of setbacks that we didn't see coming. We thought he'd play a huge part in the series but really feel for him that he won't get that opportunity."

In better news for McDonald, captain Pat Cummins is in line to return to the Australian side as they look to seal the series at the Adelaide Oval.

A cautious approach had been taken over Cummins as he dealt with a back injury but he is now deemed ready to feature.

â€œWe feel as though the simulation in the nets has got him skill ready. His body's ready to go," said McDonald.

"Barring anything else happening in the next week, I'd be expecting Pat to be tossing the coin and putting the blazer on.

"He was out at Allan Border Field whilst everyone was at the Gabba; he simulated pretty much what a match will look like out there with multiple spells.

"There won't be any match opportunities for Pat (before Adelaide) and this is something we've done with Pat before long-ish layoffs, where we've put some time and effort into rebuilding his body.

"So we feel as though he'll be as best prepared as can be."

Only one team in Test history has ever come from 2-0 down to win a Test series, an Australian side led by Don Bradman in the 1936/37 Ashes on home soil.

title: Why did Liverpool renew Mo Salah's contract? One theory stands out
description: Salah suffering from Liverpool disruptionIt must be said that eyebrows were raised when the overall package was announced upon Salahâ€™s eventual renewal. He would be tied to the Anfield club until 20...
fullText:
It must be said that eyebrows were raised when the overall package was announced upon Salahâ€™s eventual renewal. He would be tied to the Anfield club until 2027 - earning Â£400k per week in the process.

Those numbers suit a peak talent - and a world-class player. But Salah was just about to turn 33 when he signed. He will be 35 by the time the deal expires. There arenâ€™t that many 35-year-old wingers out there these days - not least one playing for a top club.

And you will scour the top five leagues for a forward player that age earning anything close to what Salah is bringing home.

Right now we must admit that Salah isnâ€™t playing like a Â£20m per year forward. Haaland by comparison is averaging very, very close to a goal a game this season for his mammoth paycheck. Salah isnâ€™t.

Nor was he ever likely to repeat last seasonâ€™s exploits. Given the wholesale disruption which took place across the club last summer it would have taken a monumental effort to sustain that output.

Then you need to factor in what was always due to happen in Salahâ€™s international career this season.

The Pharaoh talisman is no doubt closing in on the end of his playing days. The missing piece of the jigsaw in his trophy cabinet is of course the Africa Cup of Nations.

He will be desperate to finally right that wrong.

For three Afcon tournaments in a row - prior to Salahâ€™s arrival on the scene - everything Egypt touched turned to gold. But it will be 16 barren years by the time the tournament concludes in January.

His participation at Afcon was always likely to rule him out for a month or even more. Thatâ€™s Â£2m from the latest renewal that Liverpool wonâ€™t be seeing any value out of.

Then thereâ€™s the FIFA World Cup.

Egypt missed out in 2022 - and back in 2018 - when Salah was at his undoubted peak - he was recovering from the injury inflicted upon him by Sergio Ramos.

His national team NEED him - and he in turn has a great chance to definitively etch his name in the countryâ€™s collective football history. And if Salah plans to be fresh for the World Cup then itâ€™s going to take a toll.

He will be returning to Anfield exhausted - and at the age of 34 rolling straight into another gruelling season.

If this was the profile of a potential new signing - a 33-year-old winger whose form tailed off towards the end of the season and whose pay packet is Â£400k per week and who will be playing TWO international tournaments in 12 months - then do you really think Liverpoolâ€™s data specialists woud sign him?

Of course not - and his previous output would count for precisely nothing.

So what gives? Why exactly did Richard Hughes see fit to offer Salah a two-year Â£40m deal when the stakes were so high?

Maybe Liverpool didnâ€™t want to wave Salah goodbye without banking a fee. Last summer he would have left for nothing - entitled to choose his next club.

There is a premium for that - either in January or else next summer. So the club might have always assumed that Salah wouldnâ€™t see out all of his contract until 2027 - and instead planned to offload him to any team willing to pay a decent transfer fee.

Given the wages it will take quite a lot to cover that expense as well as a transfer fee so it is a very select market for the Egyptian King in January or beyond.

Saudi clubs havenâ€™t been as prone to throwing that kind of money around for players in their 30s of late - even Ronaldo came on a free after terminating his Manchester United deal.

Beyond the SPL though and itâ€™s hard to see any big teams coughing up a fee and wages for Salah.

The future right now looks very uncertain - and Liverpool will clearly not be wanting to pay Â£20m a year to Salah until the end of his contract if heâ€™s not even playing.

title: Helmut Marko set to leave Red Bull early ahead of 2026 F1 season
description: Marko is on his way out of Red Bull following a meeting with Red Bull's top management on Monday
fullText:
Helmut Marko is set for retirement as Red Bullâ€™s motorsport advisor in Formula 1, despite an initial contract for 2026.

Immediately after the title decider at the Yas Marina Circuit, uncertainty over Helmut Markoâ€™s future at Red Bull began to trickle through the paddock. When asked, the Austrian stated that discussions would take place later in the week. Whereas the 82-year-old had previously pointed to his ongoing contract, he did not do so this time.

â€œItâ€™s a complex [set] of different things,â€ he said. When asked what his own preference would be, Marko replied: â€œI have to sleep over it, and then weâ€™ll see.â€

The discussions Marko referred to on Sunday night took place on Monday in Abu Dhabi with Red Bullâ€™s top management â€“ including sporting CEO Oliver Mintzlaff. The outcome is that Marko is set for retirement at the end of this calendar year as Red Bullâ€™s motorsport advisor, noting that his influence in practice went beyond what that job title suggested.

Markoâ€™s contract had initially been extended for two more years and covered the 2026 season as well, but that term will not be completed.

Team principal Laurent Mekies already hinted on Sunday night that changes were looming. Asked about Markoâ€™s comments, the French team boss did little to quell the rumours.

â€œHelmut has been incredible in how supportive he has been in helping us to turn around things this year. Obviously him and the top management had quite a few difficult decisions to make in the year, and of course we always have. But Formula 1 is not a static environment, you always adjust your organisations, and it applies to technical, it applies to sporting.â€

Mekies subtly indicated that Red Bull was looking at ways to make its leadership structure future-proof.

â€œIt's completely normal that we review how we can improve the way we operate all the time. So I'm not saying that specifically for Helmut, but I'm saying that in general we are in an environment where we always challenge each other and look for the next steps, no matter how small it is in trying to work together. But I can only thank Helmut for the role he has played in making what looked like a difficult situation at the mid-season making work with the support,â€ said Mekies, who took over from Christian Horner this past summer.

Suggestions in the paddock are that the Austrian parent company might take a firmer grip. One option could be to involve Mintzlaff and his team more closely in the running of Red Bull's F1 operations. A new head of PR has also been put forward from the Austrian headquarters, after Paul Smith â€“ who previously held that position â€“ had to leave the team at the same time as Horner.

With Markoâ€™s upcoming retirement, an era spanning 21 years will come to an end. The former Le Mans 24 Hours winner from Graz was put forward as Dietrich Mateschitzâ€™s right-hand man to help build Red Bull Racing after the team was acquired from Jaguar ahead of the 2005 season. Marko took charge of the junior programme that produced, among others, Sebastian Vettel and Max Verstappen.

Whereas Mercedes initially wanted to place Verstappen in GP2 for a year, Marko immediately offered the Dutchman an F1 seat at sister team Toro Rosso for 2015. The loyalty between the two has long been mutual since then. When Markoâ€™s position came under pressure around the 2024 Saudi Arabian Grand Prix, amid the Horner power struggles, Verstappen firmly came to his defence. As of 31 December 2025, however, that cooperation seems to formally come to an end.

title: Hurts loses ball twice on same play as Eagles beaten
description: Jalen Hurts throws an interception and fumbles the ball on the same play as the Philadelphia Eagles are beaten by the Los Angeles Chargers in California.
fullText:
The Los Angeles Chargers claimed an overtime win over the Philadelphia Eagles in a game where Jalen Hurt lost the ball twice on one play.

The bizarre incident happened in the second quarter when the Eagles quarterback was intercepted by Da'Shawn Hand. The Chargers player then fumbled the ball and Hurts gathered it up, only to then lose the ball again when he was tackled.

Reports from the US indicate it is the first time since records of this nature began in 1978 that a player has turned the ball over twice on the same play.

Hurts threw a career-high four interceptions at the SoFi Stadium in California, the final one coming when Tony Jefferson picked off a pass at the one-yard line to end the game in overtime.

Cameron Dicker had earlier kicked what turned out to be a game-winning 54-yard field goal in the extra period to match his career-high five field goals in a single game.

Chargers quarterback Justin Herbert, who played after undergoing surgery on a fractured hand on 1 December, completed 12 of 26 passes for 139 yards.

The Chargers are second in the AFC West after making it five wins from their past six outings, while the reigning Super Bowl champions are top of the NFC East despite losing for a third successive game.

Both sides return to action on 14 December at 20:00 GMT, with the Chargers travelling to the Kansas City Chiefs and the Eagles hosting the Las Vegas Raiders.

title: NBA trade rumor rankings: Giannis Antetokounmpo, Trae Young and more
description: HoopsHype ranks the five players who have appeared most often in trade rumors over the previous week, headlined this week by Giannis Antetokounmpo.
fullText:
As we inch closer to the NBA trade deadline of 2026-27, bigger names are starting to pop up in rumors, including that of one former NBA MVP and Defensive Player of the Year.

Today, that player leads off our latest Trade Rumors Rankings series, in which we rank the five players who have appeared most often in trade rumors over the previous week.

Four-time All-Star Trae Young hasn't played since Oct. 29, and yet the Atlanta Hawks are off to as good a start as they've had in years, sitting at 14-11.

Like other enigmatic point guards, Young has heard his name mentioned in trade rumors this season, including in this report from ESPN:

Charlotte'sÂ LaMelo Ball,Â Memphis'Â Ja MorantÂ andÂ Atlanta'sÂ Trae YoungÂ all seem to be stuck in a sort of limbo with the franchises that they've been the faces of since entering the league as high lottery picks. There is rampant speculation among rival teams that Ball, Morant and Young could all be available leading up to the Feb. 5 trade deadline. For a variety of reasons, from their maximum contracts to their major flaws, it's not a discussion that generates much enthusiasm despite their status as big names who have put up big numbers.Â "I wouldn't want any of them," a Western Conference general managerÂ toldÂ ESPN. That was a popular opinion in an informal poll ofÂ executives, scouts and coaches conducted by ESPN. There wasn't a consensus about which one of the three would command the biggest return if they ended up getting shopped in the trade market, as votes were split among Ball, Morant and Young. "They all might have negative value," an Eastern ConferenceÂ executiveÂ said.

Speaking of how well the Hawks are playing without Young, an anonymous source criticized Young more to ESPN:

In other words, theÂ HawksÂ with Young in the lineup would rank dead last in the league in defensive efficiency.Â Without him, the Hawks have defended at a top-five level. "He's just small and doesn't play any defense," an East scout said. That scout valued Young more than Morant and Ball, primarily because of his offensive prowess and lack of off-court concerns. Several people mentioned the long-running perception that he's unpopular with teammates as worrisome, especially considering that Young creates so many dunks and open looks with his passing prowess.

The thing is, Young has proven in the past to be up to the task of leading a team on a deep playoff run. He just has to have a great team around him. Maybe Atlanta will be fine staying put with Young at the helm once he returns, as the team does have a strong roster this season.

Either way, it doesn't seem his trade value is all that high right now.

For the latest Trae Young rumors, click here.

The New Orleans Pelicans, owners of the worst record in the NBA at 3-22, don't have much going right for them these days, including Zion Williamson being set to miss even more time due to injury. As such, the team is naturally hearing a lot of noise as far as potential trades recently.

One player who has come up in such rumors is 25-year-old swingman Trey Murphy, who is averaging 20.5 points and 6.5 rebounds on 36.3 three-point percent shooting this season.

According to NBA reporter Jake Fischer, the Pelicans are starting to listen to offers on the Murphy trade front:

AndÂ there are definitely teams that believe that have told me as recently as today that New Orleans is now starting to listen and at least show some type of willingness to listen on guys like Herb Jones and Trey Murphy as well.Â And those guys are going to have a lot of interest around the league.

That report was negated by a Pelicans blogger, thoughâ€¦

Sharmit Dua:Â The Pelicans have not had any conversations with teams regarding Trey Murphy, Herb Jones, or Zion WilliamsonÂ per source familiar with the matter

â€¦so it should be taken for what itâ€™s worth.

In the NBA, players are untouchable until they arenâ€™t, and considering how far off the Pelicans are from contention, there shouldnâ€™t be a player on their roster who is not up for grabs on the trade market, at least anyone who isnâ€™t a rookie.

New Orleans is certainly a team that should be kept an eye on as we get closer to the trade deadline.

For the latest Trey Murphy rumors, click here.

Fischer dropped another surprising nugget recently when he reported that the Miami Heat of all teams have had internal discussions about picking up Ja Morant.

Miami was already shaping into a surprising buyer on this trade market even before this week's Giannis headlines. League sources say thatÂ the Heat, for example, have had internal discussions about Memphis' Ja Morant and how Miami's infrastructure could benefit him.

Weâ€™re not entirely sure how that fit would work, especially with how steady Davion Mitchell has been running point for Miami this season. With the Heat performing better than expected this year, and the team fully at peace after the departure of Jimmy Butler, going after Morant doesnâ€™t make the most sense for Miami, in our estimation.

At the same time, thereâ€™s no denying his massive talent level. And Miami probably wonâ€™t contend this season without more truly elite talent, so who knows? Maybe this is a swing they decide to take in an attempt to hit a grand slam.

According to the New York Times, the Sacramento Kings and Minnesota Timberwolves are monitoring the Morant trade front:

Teams such as Sacramento and the Minnesota Timberwolves (and likely many more) that were known to beÂ monitoringÂ the situation before will continue to do so, all while watching closely when Ja Morant returns (his initial timeline had him slated for a possible early December return).Â Still, the Grizzlies going from their loud and ugly 4-11 start to this quiet and impressive bounce-back (now 9-12) is enough to make these next few months all the more interesting in Memphis.

With so much smoke, the Morant situation in Memphis is one that has to continue to be monitored.

For the latest Ja Morant rumors, click here.

Since returning from injury, former No. 1 pick Anthony Davis has shown flashes of his former prime self, enjoying 32- and 29-point performances. Overall, in his last four games, Davis is averaging 20.0 points, 11.5 rebounds, 4.0 assists and 1.8 blocks on 51.5 percent shooting.

However, according to a recent report, teams might be hesitant to trade for Davis anyway due to cap restrictions:

The reluctance of teams to trade multiple first round picks into the future is expected to impact the trade packages for Davis and potentially even Giannis Antetokounmpo. "What I'm telling you is that when I talk to executives and these executives are not in trade talks with the Bucks or another for a star player right now, the mood in the NBA right now is not give up four first round picks for anybody," said Brian Windhorst on The Hoop Collective podcast on Friday. "Okay, maybe if Shai (Gilgeous-Alexander) came on, or Victor (Wembanyama)... Like people don't want to do that because the aprons have spooked so many teams.Â All these teams are worried about getting into apron trouble where they can't reset their rosters. And you get into a situation like the Celtics were in where you got to rip your team down."

Also making teams wary is his troubling injury history, including in this very season:

Brian Windhorst:Â I don't know what the valueÂ of Anthony Davis. Some of the stuffÂ that I haveÂ heardÂ fromÂ executivesÂ talking to me about what they thinkÂ Anthony Davis' trade value isâ€¦ I'm notÂ even going to say it because then I'dÂ get aggregated and people would beÂ jumping down my throat and I would just be repeating something somebody elseÂ said. When I haveÂ heardÂ what people areÂ saying Anthony Davis' trade value isÂ right now, not because of him as aÂ player, to be clear, not because he'sÂ diminished as a player, butÂ because ofÂ the idea of paying an injury-prone mid-30s guyÂ $50, $60 million dollars in the apron era isÂ unpalatable.

We arenâ€™t entirely sure how the Davis saga unfolds. On one hand, he doesnâ€™t fit the teamâ€™s current time frame, especially not with Kyrie Irving set to miss so much of this season. On the other, the Mavericks are a proud franchise and winners of four of their last five, so maybe theyâ€™d rather try to compete with Davis now healthy.

For the latest Anthony Davis rumors, click here.

The most interesting storyline of this trade deadline centers in Wisconsin, as reports have indicated that Giannis Antetokounmpo has already asked out of Milwaukee in favor of joining the New York Knicksâ€¦

Brian Windhorst:Â The Bucks called the Knicks and asked for an offer for Giannis Antetokounmpo, because Giannis said, 'I want to be a Knick.' .... Guys, Giannis has asked to be traded already. It appears Giannis committed to himself for the season to the Bucks. But the Bucks are not good. This year, when Giannis hasn't played, the Bucks are 1-5. When he has played, they're 9-8. Would his viewpoint change? I don't know.

â€¦while the Bucks have reportedly told teams that the Greek superstar is not available:

As trade season draws close, everyone is talking about Giannis.Â Even though â€” and I want to underline this â€” the Bucks continue to tell teams: 'Heâ€™s not available. We donâ€™t want your trade pitches.'Â So, itâ€™s this weird deal where the Bucks keep shouting into the wind: 'Listen to us! We donâ€™t want to talk trades with you about Giannis Antetokounmpo!' And the rest of the league just ignores it and obsesses about him."

Since the initial report from ESPNâ€™s Brian Windhorst came out, a plethora of reporting on the matter from other sources has come to light.

ESPN's Shams Charania, for example, reported afterward that Antetokounmpo and his camp have started talks with Milwaukee about whether or not Antetokounmpo will stay with the Bucks long-term:

Just in: Giannis Antetokounmpo and his agent Alex Saratsis have started conversations with the Milwaukee Bucks about the two-time NBA MVP's future â€“ and discussing whether his best fit is staying or elsewhere, sources tell ESPN. A resolution is expected in the coming weeks. pic.twitter.com/NfrpL2Ffvr

â€” Shams Charania (@ShamsCharania) December 3, 2025

ESPN also reported that it wouldnâ€™t be New-York-or-bust for Antetokounmpo:

Over the offseason, Antetokounmpo explored external options and was open to playing for one team outside of Milwaukee -- theÂ New York KnicksÂ -- as a potential trade home.Â Sources described it as an exclusive negotiating window for the Knicks over a multiweek period in August, but that will not be the case moving forward. Multiple other teams would be expected to emerge as suitors for the nine-time All-Star if trades are explored.

Doc Rivers, frustrated with the media and reporting on the matter, then said that Antetokounmpo hadnâ€™t asked for a trade:

Doc Rivers: "I want to make it clear for the - I want to say one more time - for the 50th time, and clearly it's not getting to one network, for sure, Giannis has never asked to be traded. Ever. I can't make that more clear." https://t.co/e6XSo0OuP8

â€” Eric Nehm (@eric_nehm) December 3, 2025

The Lakers, Clippers and Heat were also reportedly mentioned as other potential suitors for the former league MVP, though they were waiting until he could hit free agency in 2027.

And all of that is just a taste of the huge amount of reporting on the Antetokounmpo trade front over the last week. For even more in-depth reporting on the matter, just follow the link below.

For the latest Giannis Antetokounmpo rumors, click here.

This article originally appeared on Hoops Hype: NBA trade rumor rankings: Giannis Antetokounmpo, Trae Young and more

title: Man Utd analysis: Amorim gets much-needed win
description: Before the start of the second-half, Ruben Amorim came out alone to take his seat in the visitors' dugout.  The caption writers could have had so much fun with it if Amorim's side had failed to get out of the mess they had landed themselves in by wasting so many chances before the break.  Wolves keeper Sam Johnstone denied Diogo Dalot and Bryan Mbeumo.
fullText:
Before the start of the second-half, Ruben Amorim came out alone to take his seat in the visitors' dugout.

The caption writers could have had so much fun with it if Amorim's side had failed to get out of the mess they had landed themselves in by wasting so many chances before the break.

Wolves keeper Sam Johnstone denied Diogo Dalot and Bryan Mbeumo. When he saved from Cameroon forward Mbeumo a second time, former Wolves forward Matheus Cunha sent the rebound towards goal but Toti cleared off the line.

It even felt like United were trying not to score the goal they actually managed as Cunha elected to tee up Fernandes rather than take aim himself inside the box, before the Portuguese midfielder slipped and almost cost himself a shooting opportunity completely.

Amorim must have spent those lonely minutes before his coaching staff appeared for the start of the second half wondering what his team were going to serve up next after Wolves stunned their own supporters by equalising.

As it turned out, Wolves were not good enough to stop United taking control. But it felt like another night when there were as many questions as answers for a team which has now lost just once in nine games.

title: Cleverley discusses decisions with EFL referees' chief
description: Plymouth Argyle boss Tom Cleverley says he has spoken to the English Football League's referees' chief over decisions against his side.
fullText:
Plymouth Argyle boss Tom Cleverley says he has spoken to the English Football League's referees' chief about decisions given against his side.

Cleverley was left upset at the penalty for Bradford City which sealed the Bantams' 1-0 win at Home Park on Saturday.

He felt there had not been enough contact by defender Julio Pleguezuelo on Stephen Humphrys to justify a foul being given.

Cleverley says he has spoken with Mike Jones about the decision, as well as a number of other incidents he has been unhappy with in recent weeks.

"I don't want to reveal too much detail on that conversation," Cleverley told BBC Radio Devon.

"But he saw some of what I've seen over the last few weeks and it's been made aware of amongst the referees.

"They'll always referee the game objectively, as they should, but I think it's important I defend our team and our club for some of the decisions we've been on the wrong end of recently."

title: Voting open for World Sport Star of the Year - meet the contenders
description: Voting is open for the BBC Sports Personality's World Sport Star of the Year 2025 award.
fullText:
Six contenders have been shortlisted for the award, which will be presented during the live show on BBC One on Thursday, 18 December.

The 2024 World Sport Star award was won by Swedish pole vaulter Armand Duplantis.

Below you can vote for your favourite - and find out more about the contenders.

Spain midfielder Caldentey enjoyed a stellar first season in English football, with her performances instrumental in Arsenal's march to Champions League glory, beating her former club Barcelona in the final.

After scoring 19 goals in 41 appearances for the Gunners in her first season, Caldentey was named the Professional Footballers' Association women's player of the year and the Women's Super League player of the year.

Caldentey scored in the Women's Euro 2025 final, which Spain narrowly lost to England on penalties.

The 29-year-old was runner-up in the Ballon d'Or award, missing out to compatriot Aitana Bonmati, and was also included in Uefa's Champions League team of the year.

The making of Spain and Arsenal's humble magician

Arsenal's Caldentey wins WSL player of year award

Sport: Boxing Country: United States

Crawford cemented his status as one of the greatest boxers in history by becoming the first male fighter to be undisputed champion across three weight divisions in the four-belt era.

The 38-year-old had to go up two weight classes to face the great Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez at super-middleweight, but secured a unanimous decision in front of a fiercely pro-Mexican crowd in Las Vegas.

In claiming the WBA (Super), WBC, IBF, WBO and The Ring belts, the American extended his professional record to 42 straight victories - the past 20 of which have been world title fights.

However, Crawford was stripped of the WBC belt earlier in December, with president Mauricio Sulaiman claiming the American did not pay sanctioning fees.

'Crawford conquers Canelo to become the face of boxing'

History-maker Crawford stuns Canelo in Vegas

Sport: Athletics Country: Sweden

In 2025, Sweden's Duplantis once again soared above his rivals to capture a third pole vault World Championship gold.

In doing so, he set yet another world record of 6.30m - his fourth of this year alone - and the 14th of his remarkable career.

He also retained his indoor world title - meaning he has won eight successive golds in major global competitions - and won all 16 of his events to become the first male pole vaulter in modern history to go undefeated for two successive years.

In November, the 26-year-old was named men's world athlete of the year for a third time.

Duplantis gets 14th world record & third world title

The making of Mondo: How Duplantis is reaching new heights

Sport: Athletics Country: United States

McLaughlin-Levrone, the greatest female 400m hurdler of all time, made the switch to the 400m flat at the World Athletics Championships this year, but the result remained the same as she became the first athlete to claim career world titles in both disciplines.

Her time of 47.78 seconds was the second fastest in history and she came close to breaking a world record that has stood since 1985.

The 26-year-old is undefeated across both distances for two years.

She added another gold in the 4x400m relay in Tokyo and was named the women's world athlete of the year.

McLaughlin-Levrone wins 400m gold with second fastest time in history

Duplantis & McLaughlin-Levrone named world athletes of year

On the LA Dodgers' march towards retaining their World Series title, Japanese superstar Ohtani produced one of the greatest individual performances in Major League Baseball history.

The rare 'two-way' player, who operates as both a pitcher and a hitter, smashed three home runs and struck out 10 batters against the Milwaukee Brewers.

That made him the first pitcher since 1942 to hit three home runs in the same game.

The 31-year-old was named as one of baseball's Most Valuable Players for the third straight year, and the fourth time overall, moving him into second on the all-time list.

Ohtani wins fourth Major League MVP award

Ohtani rewrites history to send Dodgers to World Series

Salah, the 'Egyptian King', scored 29 Premier League goals and broke a host of records as he helped Liverpool to a record-equalling 20th top-flight title in the 2024-25 season.

He became the first player to win the Golden Boot, the Playmaker award for most assists and the Premier League player of the season award in the same campaign. He was also named as the PFA men's player of the year for a record third time and collected a third Football Writers' footballer of the year award.

The 33-year-old became the highest-scoring overseas player in Premier League history, overtaking Sergio Aguero's mark of 184.

Salah has scored five goals in 18 appearances for Liverpool so far this season, and on Saturday said he felt like he had been "thrown under the bus" by the club and that his relationship with head coach Arne Slot had broken down.

'The hunger makes me want more' - Salah wins third PFA award

title: Eagles open as double-digit home favorites against Raiders in Week 15
description: If the Birds canâ€™t beat Las Vegas, what are we even doing here?
fullText:
Looking for some Philadelphia Eagles optimism after the teamâ€™s overtime loss to the Los Angeles Chargers?

The losing streak might soon be coming to an end.

The Birds host the Las Vegas Raiders in Week 15 and the home team is favored by 11.5 points, according to FanDuel Sportsbook.

Further, the Eaglesâ€™ moneyline is currently -950. That means youâ€™ll need to wager $950 just to win $100. The Raidersâ€™ moneyline is +640, which means you can wager $100 to win $640.

Make no mistake: itâ€™s hard to feel amazing about the Eagles right now. But the Raiders are truly dreadful. Las Vegas has two wins this year and one of them is over the Tennessee Titans. The other was a weird Week 1 win over the New England Patriots.

The Raidersâ€™ quarterback situation is currently unclear with Geno Smith getting banged up in Week 14. If he canâ€™t play, itâ€™ll seemingly be old friend Kenny Pickett under center. Regardless, the Eaglesâ€™ defense should be able to have success against this Raiders offense. Not unlike the Chargers, the Raiders have a terrible offensive line.

While itâ€™s impossible to trust the Eaglesâ€™ offense to play well, the Raidersâ€™ defense should give them some scoring changes. Only eight teams have allowed more points than Las Vegas has this season. And it seems like Lane Johnson might be returning to the starting lineup, which could help to shut down the Raidersâ€™ best player in Maxx Crosby.

If the Eagles canâ€™t beat the Raiders, Iâ€™m not sure they can win any of their three remaining games after that. Iâ€™m taking the Eagles to beat Las Vegas but I canâ€™t be confident itâ€™ll be pretty.

title: Every word from Mohamed Salahâ€™s extraordinary rant against Liverpool and Arne Slot
description: Salah went on a tirade against the Liverpool hierarchy after being benched for a third time in a row
fullText:
Mohamed Salah went on an explosive tirade after Liverpoolâ€™s draw with Leeds on Sunday where he took aim at manager Arne Slot and the clubâ€™s hierarchy, claiming to have been thrown â€œunder the busâ€.

The Egyptian, who has lost his place in the Liverpool team, said he doesnâ€™t have a relationship with Slot any more as he accused the club of breaking their promises to him.

Salah also called out Liverpool legend-turned-pundit Jamie Carragher and lamented how he has been treated differently to fellow Premier League great Harry Kane.

Hereâ€™s every word of Salahâ€™s extraordinary rant at Elland Road.

What are you thinking sat on the bench?

â€œI don't know what to say. It's funny but I couldn't believe it. It is a really disappointing result for us as a team because we expect to win a game like that.

â€œWe managed to score two goals in the beginning and the game was going in our direction but we conceded silly goals. I'm not attacking my teammates because I was on the bench but we conceded silly goals as we did before.

â€œWe just have to try to keep a clean sheet and win games.â€

â€œThat I'm sitting on the bench for 90 minutes! The third time on the bench, I think for the first time in my career. I'm very, very disappointed to be fair. I have done so much for this club down the years and especially last season.

â€œNow I'm sitting on the bench and I don't know why. It seems like the club has thrown me under the bus. That is how I am feeling. I think it is very clear that someone wanted me to get all of the blame.

â€œI got a lot of promises in the summer and so far I am on the bench for three games so I can't say they keep the promise.

â€œI said many times before that I had a good relationship with the manager and all of a sudden, we don't have any relationship. I don't know why, but it seems to me, how I see it, that someone doesn't want me in the club.

â€œThis club, I always support it. My kids will always support it. I love the club so much I will always do. I called my mum yesterday - you guys didn't know if I would start or not, but I knew.

â€œYesterday I said to them, come to the Brighton game. I don't know if I am going to play or not but I am going to enjoy it. In my heads, I'm going to enjoy that game because I don't know what is going to happen now.

â€œI will be in Anfield to say goodbye to the fans and go the Africa Cup (of Nations). I don't know what is going to happen when I am there.â€

What do you do with the situation now?

â€œIt is not acceptable for me. I don't know why this is happening to me. I don't get it. I think if this was somewhere else, every club would protect its player.

â€œHow I see it now is like you throw Mo under the bus because he is the problem in the team now. But I don't think I am the problem. I have done so much for this club.

â€œThe respect, I want to get. I don't have to go every day fighting for my position because I earned it. I am not bigger than anyone but I earned my position. It's football. It is what it is.â€

Could Brighton be your last game for Liverpool?

â€œIn football you never know. I donâ€™t accept this situation. I have done so much for this club.â€

â€œWith respect, I love everyone. I love (Erling) Haaland, I will talk about him. I am the current top goalscorer in the Premier League. He is not yet. He is going to win it hopefully and that is fine for him. I love him and he knows that.

â€œI am top goalscorer, best player, winning the league in such a style, but I am the one who has to defend himself in front of the media and fans.â€

â€œAbsolutely. After what I have done for the club it really hurts. You can imagine, really. After going from home to the club and you donâ€™t know if you are starting. I know the club too well, I have been here many years. Tomorrow (Jamie) Carragher is going to go for me again and again and thatâ€™s fine.â€

Is a move to Saudi Arabia still on the table?

â€œI donâ€™t want to answer this question, because the club is going to take me to a different direction.â€

Is the situation now impossible to solve?

â€œI cannot say it is impossible, but from what I feel, I have done so much for the club, I love the fans and the club so much, but I donâ€™t know what is going to happen next.â€

Is it doubly frustrating that you didnâ€™t even come on against Leeds?

â€œCan you answer that? I have been at this club, scoring more than anyone in this generation, since I came to the Premier League, I donâ€™t think anyone has scored more goals and made more assists than me. In the whole Premier League. If I am somewhere else, everybody would go to the media and defend the players. I am the only one in this situation.

â€œCan I give an example? Itâ€™s silly but I am sorry. I remember a while go, Harry Kane was not scoring for 10 games, everyone in the media was like â€˜oh, Harry will score for sureâ€™, when it comes to Mo everyone is like â€˜he needs to be on the benchâ€™. I am sorry Harry!â€

When you talk about someone wanting you out, who is that?

â€œI don't know. I don't know. I really donâ€™t know.â€

Is it the sporting director, Richard Hughes?

â€œNo, no, don't put the words in my mouth. From the situation I see thatâ€™s it.â€

Had anyone communicated and explained the situation to you? Have you actually asked for that?

â€œI did. I did, but I don't see an explanation.

â€œLike I knew yesterday that I was not going to play and that's it, so take it and swallow it and go home.â€

Were told personally you weren't going to be playing by Arne Slot?

â€œYeah, he told me yesterday and had a meeting with him.â€

Did you let your feelings be known then, you were disappointed?

â€œHe knows my feeling. He knows my feeling.â€

Do you regret signing that contract?

â€œImagine how bad that I have to answer it, honestly.

â€œThat hurts, even the question hurts. This club, signing for this club, I will never regret it.

â€œI thought I'm going to renew here and end my career here, but this is not according to the plan, so I'm not regretting signing for the club for sure.â€

You're one of the greatest players in Liverpool's history. Can you believe it might end like this?

â€œSomehow it will end but the thing in my head is like why it should end this way? Because I am too fit, just five months ago I was just winning every individual award so why should it go this direction?

â€œI'm sorry everybody in a team is not in his form yet I'm the one has has to defend himself now.â€

Is the next step for you to speak to Slot again?

â€œNo, I donâ€™t think so. We spoke a lot.â€

Has the relationship broken down?

â€œYeah, there's no relationship between us.

â€œIt was very good relationship and now all of a sudden there is no relationship.â€

Has something changed behind the scenes?

â€œYou guys know better than me. I don't know.â€

Do you feel let down from your team-mates as well?

â€œNo, no, no, these guys, they know how much I love them. They know how much I support them, even inside before the game, after the game.

â€œI'm an experienced player, I've been in their position. I always support them, I always give them experience. But no, no, the players they're not connected to the situation at.

â€œEven they support me so much so there's just much love between us as players and respect.â€

title: Eagles in danger of another late-season collapse after latest unraveling
description: The Philadelphia Eagles hardly resemble the team that won Super Bowl 59 just 10 months ago. A third-consecutive loss dropped Philadelphia to 8-5.
fullText:
INGLEWOOD, CAÂ â€”Â Jalen Hurts and DeVonta Smith sat quietly next to each other in a somber postgame locker room after a 22-19 overtime loss to the Los Angeles Chargers.

The Philadelphia Eagles hardly resemble the team that won Super Bowl 59 just 10 months ago. A third consecutive loss dropped Philadelphia to 8-5.

â€œWe have won a lot of football games. Right now, we've lost three in a row,â€ Eagles coach Nick Sirianni said. â€œI'm confident in the coaches that we have, the players that we have, the owner that we have, the front office that we have. We're built to overcome, and we know how to do that.â€

Sirianni confirmed reports that he had taken more of a hands-on approach with the Eagles offense in preparation for Monday night.

Saquon Barkley did top 100 rushing yards for the second time this season, but the offense was once again mostly lethargic. Itâ€™s tough to glean confidence from this version of the Eagles' offense.

The Eagles havenâ€™t scored more than 21 points in a game since October. Philadelphia came into Week 14 with the 23rd-ranked passing attack and 22nd-ranked rushing offense in the league.

Hurts tossed a career-worst four interceptions versus the Chargers and produced a nightmare five total turnovers in the overtime defeat.

â€œI have to find ways to lead our team to victories,â€ Hurts said. â€œThatâ€™s not something thatâ€™s foreign to us. We are just not able to do it at the moment. That starts with me and how I play, how I lead and how I go out there and do my job. When I look at it at any point, itâ€™s about how I respond to a test. And what level of resilience and resolve I have to push forward and figure things out.â€

The Eagles are slightly in front of the Dallas Cowboys (6-6-1) for the NFC East lead with four regular-season games remaining. The Eaglesâ€™ three-game losing streak is reminiscent of the teamâ€™s 2023 collapse, during which they lost five of their last six regular-season games and made a quick exit in the postseason.

Yet, the silver lining is this Eagles club, despite some injuries, brought back 10 offensive starters from the Super Bowl-winning squad. Standout tackle Lane Johnson is expected to return this season. Three of their next four opponents have losing records. They control their own destiny.

â€œYou always have to look inward and be honest with yourself, first and foremost. Take accountability and learn to fix it as quickly as possible,â€ Eagles wide receiver A.J. Brown said. â€œThatâ€™s what we plan to do. Thatâ€™s what I plan to do.â€

Brown is correct. The Eagles' offense must â€œquicklyâ€ find a way to turn things around or else the season will expire quickly akin to the 2023 squad.

â€œA game like that definitely stings. But we can use this to either start pointing fingers and get upset, or we can make sure that doesn't break us and we come together and we just keep rolling. And I think we're going to take that side of it,â€ Barkley said. â€œEverything that we want is still in front of us. That's the beauty of football. That's the beauty of having success early in the season. And now we got to get things rolling.â€

Follow USA TODAY Sports' Tyler Dragon on XÂ @TheTylerDragon.

This article originally appeared on USA TODAY: Eagles in danger of another late-season collapse after latest setback

title: Bayern Munich coach Vincent Kompany looking forward to the holidays
description: Three games to go before the break.
fullText:
Bayern Munichâ€™s rip-roaring start to the 2025/26 campaign, on all fronts, seems to be sputtering just a little bit. A 5-0 smashing of VfB Stuttgart showed they have as much explosion in them as ever, but it follows a draw in the Bundesliga to Union Berlin, a bitter Champions League defeat to Arsenal, and another narrow scrape against Union in a DFB-Pokal win. The distance to the finish line of the first half of the season: so close, yet so far, and the last few matches will be a slog.

At least there is the Winterpause. The Christmas holidays will bring a period of rest and rejuvenation for the weary Bayern squad, and it is something new for Bayernâ€™s Premier League-seasoned coach, Vincent Kompany.

â€œI spent 11 years in England, and there Christmas was almost always synonymous with football,â€ Kompany explained in comments captured by @iMiaSanMia. â€œNow, in Germany, I can experience this holiday like a 12-year-old again â€” without any distractions, completely with my family. I really enjoy that.â€

With pressure mounting, match fatigue setting in, and key injury returns just around the corner, this yearâ€™s holiday season could hardly come at a better time. Get that R&R!

If you are looking for more Bayern Munich and German national team coverage, check out the latest episodes of Bavarian Podcast Works, which you can get on Acast, Spotify, Apple, or any leading podcast distributorâ€¦

title: Kobbie Mainoo: Man United legends urge star to abandon club
description: Manchester United midfielder Kobbie Mainoo has struggled for game time this season.Struggle for minutesMainoo has had to adapt to a significantly reduced role during Ruben Amorimâ€™s time as manager a...
fullText:
Manchester United midfielder Kobbie Mainoo has struggled for game time this season.

Mainoo has had to adapt to a significantly reduced role during Ruben Amorimâ€™s time as manager at the club.

The England international was an automatic starter for Erik ten Hag but has fallen down the pecking order at Old Trafford. Bruno Fernandes and Casemiro are very much Amorimâ€™s first-choice midfield pairing, and Mainooâ€™s game time is not helped by the lack of European football this season for the Red Devils.

Mainoo has played in 10 Premier League matches this season but has failed to earn a single start. Moreover, he has played just 183 minutes of action during that time.

He also failed to get off the bench last Thursday against West Ham United at Old Trafford.

As a result, Mainoo has been heavily linked with a move away from the club this winter.

The young midfielder is said to be interested in a loan move to SSC Napoli, where he would join up with former teammates Scott McTominay and Rasmus Hojlund.

There have also been reports of other big European teams such as Chelsea and Bayern Munich taking an interest in the 21-year-old.

Two former Manchester United academy graduates, Paul Scholes and Nicky Butt, have expressed their sympathy for Mainooâ€™s current situation.

Speaking on The Good, The Bad & The Football podcast, Scholes argued, â€œRuben Amorim has said Kobbie Mainoo is a starterâ€¦ every appearance heâ€™s made in the Premier League has been as a sub. Things like that wind me up. I wouldnâ€™t mind if he was in a good team and they were winning every week and keeping possession but theyâ€™re rubbish.â€

He continued, â€œKobbie is a 20-year-old kid and heâ€™s not playing, heâ€™s going to have to leave. Do you know what will happen now? Amorim will bring him into a game and he wonâ€™t be great but thatâ€™s because he needs regular games.â€

Scholes also theorised that Mainoo is outperforming Casemiro in training but is still not getting a look in.

Butt wholeheartedly agreed and asserted, â€œthe Kobbie one is an absolute joke. I went to the West Ham game [a 1-1 draw at Old Trafford] and it was an absolute s***show. It was a terrible, boring game. The player to bring on to change the game, in my opinion, was Kobbie Mainoo â€“ but he didnâ€™t get on the pitch. Heâ€™ll be another homegrown player who leaves and is a superstar somewhere else.â€

The former midfielder also claimed that were Mainoo playing for another Premier League team, United would be keen to snap him up for Â£70m or Â£80 million.

Butt concluded, â€œheâ€™s a top, top, top player that we are f****** up. Kobbie has got to go. If Iâ€™m looking after him Iâ€™m telling him â€˜weâ€™re getting you out of that football clubâ€™.

The former Head of the Academy claimed that it would be â€œembarrassingâ€ if he went to Chelsea but that he could certainly see Mainoo moving to Stamford Bridge in the near future.

Featured image Shaun Botterill via Getty Images

The Peoples Person has been one of the worldâ€™s leading Man United news sites for over a decade. bsky.social

title: AC Milan plotting shocking January swap deal involving Barcelona veteran â€“ report
description: Recent claims emerging from Italy, as echoed by Mundo Deportivo, have sparked intense debate, with reports suggesting a dramatic twist in Robert Lewandowskiâ€™s future at Barcelona.Â According to thes...
fullText:
Recent claims emerging from Italy, as echoed by Mundo Deportivo, have sparked intense debate, with reports suggesting a dramatic twist in Robert Lewandowskiâ€™s future at Barcelona.

According to these updates, AC Milan are exploring the possibility of a sensational January swap deal involving Christopher Nkunku and the Polish striker, a proposal that would rank among the most unexpected moves of the winter window.

Lewandowskiâ€™s situation at Barcelona has been subject to growing scrutiny in recent weeks.

With his contract entering its final stretch and the club quietly preparing for life beyond one of Europeâ€™s most prolific forwards, the sense of uncertainty around him has only intensified.

His age and the financial weight of a potential renewal make his long-term continuity increasingly unlikely, leaving Barcelona in a position where securing a replacement appears not only necessary but far more feasible than before.

Against this backdrop, Milanâ€™s interest comes into sharp focus.

AC Milan are ready to offer Christopher Nkunku. (Photo by Alessandro Sabattini/Getty Images)

The Italian giants are reportedly considering bringing Lewandowski long before his contract expires, rather than waiting for the opportunity to sign him as a free agent in 2026.

To strengthen their case, the Serie A club is said to be willing to include Nkunku in an exchange deal, a move that would give Barcelona an instant, high-profile attacking reinforcement.

Initial reports suggested Milan were preparing to hold talks with agent Pini Zahavi, who represents both Lewandowski and Nkunku, to explore whether such a transfer could gain momentum.

However, sources close to the Barcelona striker have firmly denied that any such meeting has been scheduled, signalling that the situation may be far less advanced than the Italian whispers imply.

Still, the dynamics within Barcelona cannot be ignored, as Lewandowskiâ€™s decreasing influence, combined with Ferran Torresâ€™ growing prominence, is putting the Pole in a difficult spot.

From Milanâ€™s perspective, this shift only strengthens the logic behind attempting an opportunistic move.

title: Salah 'can't complain' and 'needs to be gone' - the case against
description: Ian: Who does Salah think he is saying he has earned his place in the team?  In my opinion Salah should be sold in January before he upsets the squad more than it is already.  Others could equally be dropped for a game or two, but with no centre half options selling Salah and bringing in Guehi is a must.
fullText:
We asked for your views on Mohamed Salah's comments, the fallout, him being left out of Liverpool's Champions league squad, and the future.

Here are some of your views reflecting less favourably on the the Egypt international's conduct:

Ian: Who does Salah think he is saying he has earned his place in the team? Places are fought for game after game and if the manager thinks you aren't pulling your weight you are dropped. In my opinion Salah should be sold in January before he upsets the squad more than it is already.

Andrew: It's the right call, he's not bigger than the club and appears past his best on form this season. Others could equally be dropped for a game or two, but with no centre half options selling Salah and bringing in Guehi is a must.

John: Salah is out of order and out of form so Slot and Liverpool were right to drop him. All he should be doing instead of sulking is working hard to get his place back.

Heidi: Not the Liverpool way. Set an example and find that spark when your form is dipping. Torching your legacy to play in the Saudi Pro League? Fine, the very deserving Ian Rush and Roger Hunt get to keep their well-earned goal records.

Keith: Salah can't complain, he did this to himself. Not content with the pain Liverpool fans are enduring in results, he chose to add an embarrassing sideshow to the mix.

Stephen: Saddened, this stuff needs to be kept in-house but he knows that. No person is bigger than LFC. He himself must know his form has dropped off a cliff this season. He should apologise publicly for the outburst. Does he really want to play in the Saudi league now? I 'd be very surprised to see any interest from elsewhere? He needs to think very carefully about what he's done and the consequences. Mo, you're bigger and better than that - you and your agent know it and so does everybody else.

John: It's probably the right call, leaving the door slightly ajar for Salah to come up with a public apology, to fans, team mates, Slot and the club. He's miscalculated big time and without a full retraction he's almost certainly played his last game for the Reds. It would be a sad end to a glittering Liverpool career.

Paul: I love Mo, like every other Liverpool fan. But he needs to be gone after the Afcon for this behaviour. Otherwise it will lead to the same player power shambles that Man Utd have experienced the last few years. If he comes back into the fold after this then players present and future will think they can get away with being entitled at LFC.

AJC: A pointless and untimely tantrum. Slot is looking for solutions and in this moment he's experimenting on what we are like using alternatives on the right. Salah is off to the Afcon shortly. Makes sense to me. Stop sulking Mo.

title: Salah's comments 'a disgrace' and 'choreographed' - Carragher
description: Liverpool were top of league, he'd just scored the winning goal at Southampton and that was time to come out and put pressure on the Liverpool ownership.  Egypt in Afcon are the most successful nation but Salah has never won Afcon.
fullText:
Legendary Liverpool defender Jamie Carragher had this to say when discussing Mohamed Salah on Sky Sports' Monday Night Football:

"I thought it was a disgrace what he did after the game. Some people have painted it as an emotional outburst. I don't think it was.

"I think whenever Mo Salah stops in a mixed zone, which he's done four times in eight years at Liverpool, it's choreographed with him and his agent to cause maximum damage and strengthen his own position.

"He did that 12 months ago and I called him out about it. He played on the heartstrings of Liverpool supporters. Liverpool were top of league, he'd just scored the winning goal at Southampton and that was time to come out and put pressure on the Liverpool ownership.

"For the rest of the season you had banners in the crowd saying 'Give Mo his dough'.

"He's chosen this weekend to do this now and has waited for a bad result for Liverpool, when the supporters and everyone involved in club feels like they are in the gutter. He's chose that time to go for the manager and maybe he's trying to to get him sacked.

"That's the way I felt about it.

"The 'thrown under the bus' line stands out to me. He's tried to do that to the club twice in the last 12 months.

"He's going after owners initially who have paid him hundreds of thousands of pounds over the last six years and complained he's not got a huge contract at the age of 32 when they're more than entitled to do that.

"With the manager right now, he should be trying to do as much as possible to get the club out of their worst run since the 1950s and hasn't done that.

"I want to remind Salah and his agent that before he came to Liverpool he was known as the guy who failed at Chelsea. He had never won a major trophy.

"He is also the greatest player his country has ever had. Egypt in Afcon are the most successful nation but Salah has never won Afcon.

"This is not me trying to put Salah down - he is one of best players in the world.

"But it tells Salah and his agent it is not about an individual. He wasn't a big star before he came to Liverpool and he has not won anything with Egypt.

"You need help from team-mates, managers and fans. It is really important he remembers that.

"In the mixed zone, all he's about is me, me, me."

title: Barcelona uncover 500 illegal ticket sales by club members ahead of â€˜high riskâ€™ Frankfurt clash
description: A recent report from AS has revealed a serious breach within FC Barcelonaâ€™s ticketing system ahead of the high-risk Champions League clash against Eintracht Frankfurt.Â According to the outlet, the ...
fullText:
A recent report from AS has revealed a serious breach within FC Barcelonaâ€™s ticketing system ahead of the high-risk Champions League clash against Eintracht Frankfurt.

According to the outlet, the Catalan club has identified around 500 cases of illegal ticket resales carried out by their own members.

As such, this issue that immediately triggered cancellations and could lead to some of the harshest disciplinary measures available, including expulsion from membership.

Barcelonaâ€™s vigilance comes from the painful memory of April 2022, when approximately 30,000 Frankfurt fans flooded the Camp Nou during a Europa League fixture.

Determined to avoid a repeat, the board implemented strict measures for this match, restricting ticket sales exclusively to BarÃ§a members and allocating the German side no more than UEFAâ€™s mandated 5% of stadium capacity.

Despite those measures, the club discovered a significant number of members attempting to resell their tickets for profit.

Camp Nou was flooded with Eintracht Frankfurt fans in 2022. (Photo by David Ramos/Getty Images)

Barcelona have acted by immediately cancelling all offending tickets and have confirmed that once the full list of violations is finalised, each case will be sent to the Disciplinary Committee.

Given the encounterâ€™s â€˜High Riskâ€™ status, the institution has activated enhanced security protocols.

The club is urging any individuals without valid tickets to avoid travelling to the stadium, stressing that there will be no ticket windows open on matchday.

Authorities are also implementing strict controls on rival supporters, as German team colours, symbols and apparel may only be worn within the designated away sector.

The Anti-Violence Commissionâ€™s guidelines have also been fully applied. These include nominative tickets, a complete ban on away-fan activities within home-supporter zones and blocking online purchases from foreign IP addresses.

Barcelonaâ€™s position is uncompromising, and understandably, they are safeguarding the integrity of this important fixture.

title: Chelsea drawn against Charlton Athletic in FA Cup third round
description: New year, new comp
fullText:
Championship opposition await Chelsea in the third round of the FA Cup, on the second weekend of the new year (weekend of January 10), as The Blues were drawn against Charlton Athletic for our first match in this yearâ€™s edition of footballâ€™s oldest knockout competition. The draw was held last night, with our good pal Joe Cole helping out with the ball-picking.

Though the match will be away, Charlton, who got promoted from League One last year via the playoffs, are one of the less good teams in the second division, currently sitting 17th, having lost four in a row conceding twelve times in the process. We should be able to rest and rotate and still advance without too much trouble (â€œshouldâ€).

Itâ€™s been nearly 20 years since The Addicks were in the top flight, and in fact, we havenâ€™t played them since their relegation in 2007.

The draw for the third round of the 2025-26 FA Cup, in full, is as follows:
